Item.Name: 'State before' frequencies
Item.Description: Quantifier test applied to the state-before set data only

Item.Name: 'State after' frequencies
Item.Description: Quantifier test applied to the state-after set data only

Item.Name: Delta of absolute frequencies values
Item.Description: Quantifier test applied to the 4ft-table computed by substracting of corresponding frequencies

Item.Name: Delta of relative frequencies values
Item.Description: Quantifier test applied to the 4ft-table computed by substracting of corresponding relative frequencies

Item.Name: Difference of interest-measures
Item.Description: Test applied to the difference of interest-measures computed separately from each frequency table

Item.Name: Absolute difference of interest-measures
Item.Description: Test applied to the absolute difference of interest-measures computed separately from each frequency table

Item.Name: Ratio of interest-measures
Item.Description: Test applied to the ratio of interest-measures computed separately from each frequency table

Item.Name: Higher of two ratios of interest-measures
Item.Description: Test applied to the higher of two ratios of interest-measures (after/before or before/after)

Item.Name: Before
Item.Description: State before action

Item.Name: After
Item.Description: State after action

Item.Name: Stable
Item.Description: Stable with no action

Item.Name: Variable
Item.Description: Variable with action possible

Item.Name: Sum of frequencies
Item.Description: Sum of frequencies from source contingency table

Item.Name: Min frequency
Item.Description: Minimal frequency from source contingency table

Item.Name: Max frequency
Item.Description: Maximal frequency from source contingency table

Item.Name: p-Implication
Item.Description: a/(a+b) >= p ... at least 100*p [%] of objects satisfying A satisfy also S

Item.Name: Average Difference Dependence
Item.Description: Relative difference in number of objects satisfying S among objects satisfying A to number objects saysfying S in the whole data matrix. Paramater p in <-1;inf), similar to the Lift(X->Y)= P(Y|X)/P(Y). It holds p= P(Y|X)/P(Y)-1.

Item.Name: Above Average Dependence
Item.Description: Among objects satisfying A, there are at least 100*p [%] more objects satisfying S than there are objects satisfying S in the whole data matrix. Parameter p in <0;inf).

Item.Name: Below Average Dependence
Item.Description: Among objects satisfying A, there are at least 100*p [%] less objects satisfying S than there are objects satisfying S in the whole data matrix. Parameter p in <0;1>.

Item.Name: Outside Average Dependence
Item.Description: Among objects satisfying A, there is at least 100*p [%] more or less objects satisfying S than there are objects satisfying S in the whole data matrix. Parameter p in <0;1>.

Item.Name: a-frequency
Item.Description: a-frequency (BASE) from source contingency table

Item.Name: Absolute number
Item.Description: Absolute number. Threshold value is left as given.

Item.Name: Relative [%] to act condition
Item.Description: Relative to number of rows matching condition. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows matching condition)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to all objects
Item.Description: Relative to number of all rows in the data matrix. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows in the whole matrix)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to max frequency
Item.Description: Relative to maximal value in the current contingency table. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (the highest frequency)/100

Item.Name: Count(*)
Item.Description: Number of rows in group.

Item.Name: Sum
Item.Description: Sum of values in group. Each category is represented by its index.

Item.Name: Minimum
Item.Description: Minimum value in group. Each category is represented by its index.

Item.Name: Maximum
Item.Description: Maximum value in group. Each category is represented by its index.

Item.Name: Average
Item.Description: Average value in group. Each category is represented by its index.

Item.Name: Conjunction
Item.Description: Logical operation of conjunction

Item.Name: Disjunction
Item.Description: Logical operation of disjunction

Item.Name: No boolean
Item.Description: Not boolean category

Item.Name: True
Item.Description: Category representing 'TRUE' values

Item.Name: False
Item.Description: Category representing 'FALSE' values

Item.Name: Sharp
Item.Description: Include border value

Item.Name: No sharp
Item.Description: Don't include border value

Item.Name: Enumeration
Item.Description: Enumeration of values

Item.Name: Interval
Item.Description: Interval of values

Item.Name: Fuzzy interval
Item.Description: Fuzzy intervals

Item.Name: Antecedent
Item.Description: Left 4ft-cedent

Item.Name: Succedent
Item.Description: Right 4ft-cedent

Item.Name: Condition
Item.Description: Condition

Item.Name: First set
Item.Description: First set for difference

Item.Name: Second set
Item.Description: Second set for difference

Item.Name: Variable antecedent
Item.Description: Action in antecedent

Item.Name: Variable succedent
Item.Description: Action in succedent

Item.Name: Histogram attribute
Item.Description: Attribute used for calculation of CF-histogram

Item.Name: Row attribute
Item.Description: Row attribute for KL-table

Item.Name: Col attribute
Item.Description: Column attribut for KL-table

Item.Name: ETree Attribute
Item.Description: Attribute used in tree

Item.Name: Class Attribute
Item.Description: Target class attribute

Item.Name: Vector Attribute
Item.Description: Attribute used in clustering

Item.Name: MI Conditioned be
Item.Description: Condition for a mutual influence truthfullness scope

Item.Name: MI Not influenced by
Item.Description: Condition not influencing a mutual influence truthfullness

Item.Name: Absolute number
Item.Description: Absolute frequencies. Frequencies in histogram are left as given.

Item.Name: Relative [%] to act condition
Item.Description: Relative frequencies to number of rows matching condition. Frequencies are divided by number of rows matching condition and multiplied by 100.

Item.Name: Relative [%] for each category
Item.Description: Relative frequencies for each category (number of rows matching condition to number of all). Each frequency is divided by the corresponding frequency in the whole matrix and multiplied by 100.

Item.Name: Absolute number
Item.Description: Absolute number of steps. Count value is left as given.

Item.Name: Relative [%] to act range
Item.Description: Relative to number of categories in the currently selected range- 1. Count value is multiplied by ('number of categories in current range minus 1')/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to all categories
Item.Description: Relative to number of all categories minus 1. Count value is multiplied by ('total number of categories minus 1')/100

Item.Name: Absolute number
Item.Description: Change in frequency as an absolute number. Minimal step size is left as given.

Item.Name: Relative [%] to previous frequency
Item.Description: Relative to the previous frequency. Minimal step size is multiplied by (frequency of the previous category)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to all objects
Item.Description: Relative to number of all rows in the data matrix. Minimal step size is multiplied by (number of rows in the whole matrix)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to act condition
Item.Description: Relative to number of rows matching condition. Minimal step size is multiplied by (number of rows matching condition)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to max frequency
Item.Description: Relative to maximal frequency in the currently processed histogram. Minimal step size is multiplied by (the highest frequency in the whole histogram)/100

Item.Name: Sum of frequencies
Item.Description: Sum of frequencies from range of categories

Item.Name: Min frequency
Item.Description: Minimal frequency from range of categories

Item.Name: Max frequency
Item.Description: Maximal frequency from range of categories

Item.Name: Average frequency
Item.Description: Average frequency from range of categories

Item.Name: Some frequency
Item.Description: At least one frequency from range of categories

Item.Name: Variation ratio
Item.Description: Variation ratio = 1-f(modal)

Item.Name: Nominal variation (norm)
Item.Description: Nominal variation (norm) = suma(f_i*(1-f_i)) * K/(K-1), where f_i is frequency of the i-th category and K is number of categories

Item.Name: Discrete ordinary variation (norm)
Item.Description: Discrete Ordinary Variation (norm) = 2*suma(F_i*(1-F_i))* 2/(K-1), where F_i is cumulative relative frequency of the i-th category and K is number of categories

Item.Name: Median-category index (absolute)
Item.Description: Index (absolute <1;K>) of the median category

Item.Name: Median-category index (relative)
Item.Description: Index (relative <0;1>) of the median category

Item.Name: Arithmetic average
Item.Description: Arithmetic average of cardinal values. Only for cardinal attributes.

Item.Name: Geometric average
Item.Description: Geometric average of cardinal values. Only for cardinal attributes.

Item.Name: Variance
Item.Description: Variance of cardinal values. Only for cardinal attributes.

Item.Name: Standard deviation
Item.Description: Standard deviation of cardinal values. Only for cardinal attributes.

Item.Name: Skewness
Item.Description: Skewness of distribution of cardinal values. Only for cardinal attributes.

Item.Name: Asymetry
Item.Description: Asymetry coeficient of distribution of cardinal values. Only for cardinal attributes.

Item.Name: Steps-up
Item.Description: Number of steps-up in frequency of adjectant categories from given range in histogram

Item.Name: Steps-down
Item.Description: Number of steps-down in frequency of adjectant categories from given range in histogram

Item.Name: PattDiffSum
Item.Description: Sum of absolute values of differences of frequencies in the histogram and a given pattern

Item.Name: PattDiffMin
Item.Description: The minimal of absolute values of differences of frequencies in the histogram and a given pattern

Item.Name: PattDiffMax
Item.Description: The maximal of absolute values of differences of frequencies in the histogram and a given pattern

Item.Name: Variation from pattern
Item.Description: Total variation from given pattern

Item.Name: Absolute number
Item.Description: Absolute number. Threshold value is left as given.

Item.Name: Relative [%] to act condition
Item.Description: Relative to number of rows matching condition. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows matching condition)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to all objects
Item.Description: Relative to number of all rows in the data matrix. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows in the whole matrix)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to max frequency
Item.Description: Relative to maximal frequency in the whole histogram. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (the highest frequency in the whole histogram)/100

Item.Name: Subsets
Item.Description: All the subsets of categories from minimal up to maximal length

Item.Name: One category
Item.Description: Only one selected category appears in literal

Item.Name: Sequences
Item.Description: All the consecutive sequencies of categories from minimal up to maximal length

Item.Name: Cyclical sequences
Item.Description: Same as the sequence plus overlapping combinations of first and last categories

Item.Name: Cuts
Item.Description: All the cuts of categories from minimal up to maximal length

Item.Name: Left cuts
Item.Description: All the left cuts of categories from minimal up to maximal length

Item.Name: Right cuts
Item.Description: All the right cuts of categories from minimal up to maximal length

Item.Name: Equal
Item.Description: Equal value

Item.Name: Less than
Item.Description: Less than

Item.Name: Less than or equal
Item.Description: Less than or equal

Item.Name: Greater than
Item.Description: Greater than

Item.Name: Greater than or equal
Item.Description: Greater than or equal

Item.Name: Not equal
Item.Description: Not equal value

Item.Name: Ordinary DB field
Item.Description: Ordinary database column

Item.Name: Derived
Item.Description: Derived column by expression

Item.Name: SQL-query
Item.Description: Column computed as an SQL query

Item.Name: Geo
Item.Description: Column computed as a geographical relation of a point to a set of points or polygons

Item.Name: Date-time partial value
Item.Description: A single partial value derived from the DateTime column

Item.Name: Multi-column field
Item.Description: One field of a multi-column

Item.Name: Task-results derived value
Item.Description: Derived column based on results of a hypothesis

Item.Name: Task-results derived value
Item.Description: One component of a Principal component analysis

Item.Name: Nominal
Item.Description: Nominal values

Item.Name: Ordinal
Item.Description: Ordinal values with an order defined

Item.Name: Cardinal
Item.Description: Cardinal values with a distance defined

Item.Name: Not set
Item.Description: Unknown character of values

Item.Name: Stored table
Item.Description: Data statically stored in database table

Item.Name: Dynamic view
Item.Description: Dynamically created view from (multiple) database tables

Item.Name: Year
Item.Description: Year-value of the date

Item.Name: Month
Item.Description: Month-value of the date

Item.Name: Day
Item.Description: Day-value from of the date

Item.Name: Hour
Item.Description: Hour-value of the time

Item.Name: Min
Item.Description: Minutes-value of the time

Item.Name: Sec
Item.Description: Seconds-value of the time

Item.Name: DayOfWeek
Item.Description: Day of the week of the date

Item.Name: DayOfYear
Item.Description: Day of the year of the date

Item.Name: WeekOfYear
Item.Description: Week of the year of the date

Item.Name: Quarter
Item.Description: Quarter of the year of the date

Item.Name: DayOfRange
Item.Description: Day index within the min-max range of dates in the corresponding column

Item.Name: MonthOfRange
Item.Description: Month index within the min-max range of dates in the corresponding column

Item.Name: Not set
Item.Description: Not applicable to this attribute

Item.Name: Absolute number
Item.Description: Absolute number of steps. Count value is left as given.

Item.Name: Relative [%] to act range
Item.Description: Relative to number of categories in the currently selected range- 1. Count value is multiplied by ('number of categories in current range minus 1')/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to all categories
Item.Description: Relative to number of all categories minus 1. Count value is multiplied by ('total number of categories minus 1')/100

Item.Name: Absolute number
Item.Description: Change in frequency as an absolute number. Minimal step size is left as given.

Item.Name: Relative [%] to previous frequency
Item.Description: Relative to the previous frequency. Minimal step size is multiplied by (frequency of the previous category)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to all objects
Item.Description: Relative to number of all rows in the data matrix. Minimal step size is multiplied by (number of rows in the whole matrix)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to act condition
Item.Description: Relative to number of rows matching condition. Minimal step size is multiplied by (number of rows matching condition)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to max frequency
Item.Description: Relative to maximal frequency in the currently processed histogram. Minimal step size is multiplied by (the highest frequency in the whole histogram)/100

Item.Name: Sum of frequencies
Item.Description: Sum of frequencies from range of categories

Item.Name: Min frequency
Item.Description: Minimal frequency from range of categories

Item.Name: Max frequency
Item.Description: Maximal frequency from range of categories

Item.Name: Average frequency
Item.Description: Average frequency from range of categories

Item.Name: Some frequency
Item.Description: At least one frequency from range categories

Item.Name: Variation ratio
Item.Description: Variation ratio = 1-f(modal)

Item.Name: Nominal variation (norm)
Item.Description: Nominal variation (norm) = suma(f(i)*(1-f(i))) * K/(K-1)

Item.Name: Discrete ordinary variation (norm)
Item.Description: Discrete Ordinary Variation (norm) = 2*suma(F(i)*(1-F(i))* 2/(K-1)

Item.Name: Arithmetic average
Item.Description: Arithmetic average of cardinal values

Item.Name: Geometric average
Item.Description: Geometric average of cardinal values

Item.Name: Variance
Item.Description: Variance of cardinal values

Item.Name: Standard deviation
Item.Description: Standard deviation of cardinal values

Item.Name: Skewness
Item.Description: Skewness of distribution of cardinal values

Item.Name: Asymetry
Item.Description: Asymetry coeficient of distribution of cardinal values

Item.Name: Steps-up
Item.Description: Number of steps-up in frequency of adjectant categories in histogram

Item.Name: Steps-down
Item.Description: Number of steps-down in frequency of adjectant categories in histogram

Item.Name: Variation from pattern
Item.Description: Total variation from given pattern

Item.Name: Absolute number
Item.Description: Absolute number. Threshold value is left as given.

Item.Name: Relative [%] to act condition
Item.Description: Relative to number of rows matching condition. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows matching condition)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to all objects
Item.Description: Relative to number of all rows in the data matrix. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows in the whole matrix)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to max frequency
Item.Description: Relative to maximal value in the current contingency table. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (the highest frequency in the whole histogram)/100

Item.Name: Sum of frequencies
Item.Description: Sum of frequencies from source contingency table

Item.Name: Min frequency
Item.Description: Minimal frequency from source contingency table

Item.Name: Max frequency
Item.Description: Maximal frequency from source contingency table

Item.Name: p-Implication
Item.Description: a/(a+b) >= p ... at least 100*p [%] of objects satisfying A satisfy also S

Item.Name: Average Difference Dependence
Item.Description: Relative difference in number of objects satisfying S among objects satisfying A to number objects saysfying S in the whole data matrix. Paramater p in <-1;inf), similar to the Lift(X->Y)= P(Y|X)/P(Y). It holds p= P(Y|X)/P(Y)-1.

Item.Name: Above Average Dependence
Item.Description: Among objects satisfying A there are at least 100*p [%] more objects satisfying S than there are objects satisfying S in the whole data matrix. Parameter p in <0;inf).

Item.Name: Below Average Dependence
Item.Description: Among objects satisfying A there are at least 100*p [%] less objects satisfying S than there are objects satisfying S in the whole data matrix. Parameter p in <0;1>.

Item.Name: Outside Average Dependence
Item.Description: Among objects satisfying A, there is at least 100*p [%] more or less objects satisfying S than there are objects satisfying S in the whole data matrix. Parameter p in <0;1>.

Item.Name: Lower Critical Implication
Item.Description: The binomical test rejects on the level alpha the null hypothesis P(S|A)<=p in favour of alternative P(S|A)>p

Item.Name: Upper Critical Implication
Item.Description: The binomical test does not reject on the level alpha the null hypothesis P(S|A)<=p in favour of alternative P(S|A)>p

Item.Name: Double p-Implication
Item.Description: a/(a+b+c) >= p ... at least 100*p [%] of objects satisfying A or S satisfy both A and S

Item.Name: Double Lower Critical Implication
Item.Description: The binomical test rejects on the level alpha the null hypothesis P(AandS|AorS)<=p in favour of alternative P(AandS|AorS)>p

Item.Name: Double Upper Critical Implication
Item.Description: The binomical test does not reject on the level alpha the null hypothesis P(AandS|AorS)<=p in favour of alternative P(AandS|AorS)>p

Item.Name: p-Equivalence
Item.Description: (a+d)/n >= p ... at least 100*p [%] objects have the same truth value for A and S

Item.Name: Lower Critical Equivalence
Item.Description: The binomical test rejects on the level alpha the null hypothesis P(A and S have the same truth value)<=p in favour of alternative P(A and S have the same truth value)>p

Item.Name: Upper Critical Equivalence
Item.Description: The binomical test does not reject on the level alpha the null hypothesis P(A and S have the same truth value)<=p in favour of alternative P(A and S have the same truth value)>p

Item.Name: Simple Deviation
Item.Description: a*d > exp(sigma)*b*c

Item.Name: Fisher quantifier
Item.Description: The one-sided Fisher test rejects on the level alpha the null hypothesis of independence of A and S in favour of the alternative of their positive logarithmic interaction

Item.Name: Chi-Squared quantifier
Item.Description: The one-sided Fisher test asymptotically rejects on the level alpha the null hypothesis of independence of A and S in favour of the alternative of their positive logarithmic interaction

Item.Name: a-frequency
Item.Description: a-frequency (BASE) from source contingency table

Item.Name: Absolute number
Item.Description: Absolute number. Threshold value is left as given.

Item.Name: Relative [%] to act condition
Item.Description: Relative to number of rows matching condition. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows matching condition)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to all objects
Item.Description: Relative to number of all rows in the data matrix. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows in the whole matrix)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to max frequency
Item.Description: Relative to maximal value in the current contingency table. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (the highest frequency)/100

Item.Name: Sum of frequencies
Item.Description: Sum of frequencies from given part of source contingency table

Item.Name: Min frequency
Item.Description: Minimal frequency from given part of source contingency table

Item.Name: Max frequency
Item.Description: Maximal frequency from given part of source contingency table

Item.Name: Average frequency
Item.Description: Average frequency from given part of source contingency table

Item.Name: Some frequency
Item.Description: At least one frequency from given part of source contingency table

Item.Name: Cramer's V coefficient
Item.Description: Cramer's V (association of two nominal variables) in <0;1> (the farther is value from 0 the more dependant)

Item.Name: Kendall's TauB coefficient
Item.Description: Value of TauB in <-1;1> (the farther is value from 0 the more dependant)

Item.Name: Chi-square test
Item.Description: Chi-square test of similarity (the greater value the more dependant)

Item.Name: Conditional entropy H(C|R)
Item.Description: Conditional entropy of columns given rows (the lower value the more dependant <0;log2(L)>)

Item.Name: Mutual information MI(R,C) normalized
Item.Description: Mutual information between rows and columns (the greater value the more dependant <0;1>)

Item.Name: Inf. dependence ID(R,C)
Item.Description: Information dependence between rows and columns (the greater value the more dependant <0;1>)

Item.Name: Asymetric information coefficient AIC(R,C)
Item.Description: Value of asymetric information coefficient Theta (the greater value the more dependant <0;1>)

Item.Name: Absolute number
Item.Description: Absolute number. Threshold value is left as given.

Item.Name: Relative [%] to act condition
Item.Description: Relative to number of rows matching condition. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows matching condition)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to all objects
Item.Description: Relative to number of all rows in the data matrix. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows in the whole matrix)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to max frequency
Item.Description: Relative to maximal frequency in the current contingency table. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (the highest frequency in the whole KL-table)/100

Item.Name: Support
Item.Description: a/(a+b+c+d) >= p ... at least 100*p [%] of objects satisfy both A and S

Item.Name: p-Implication
Item.Description: a/(a+b) >= p ... at least 100*p [%] of objects satisfying A satisfy also S

Item.Name: Above Average Dependence
Item.Description: Among objects satisfying A, there is at least 100*p [%] more objects satisfying S than there are objects satisfying S in the whole data matrix. Parameter p in <0;inf).

Item.Name: Below Average Dependence
Item.Description: Among objects satisfying A, there is at least 100*p [%] less objects satisfying S than there are objects satisfying S in the whole data matrix. Parameter p in <0;1>.

Item.Name: Outside Average Dependence
Item.Description: Among objects satisfying A, there is at least 100*p [%] more or less objects satisfying S than there are objects satisfying S in the whole data matrix. Parameter p in <0;1>.

Item.Name: Average Difference Dependence
Item.Description: Relative difference in number of objects satisfying S among objects satisfying A to number objects saysfying S in the whole data matrix. Paramater p in <-1;inf), similar to the Lift(X->Y)= P(Y|X)/P(Y). It holds p= P(Y|X)/P(Y)-1.

Item.Name: Lower Critical Implication
Item.Description: The binomical test rejects on the level alpha the null hypothesis P(S|A)<=p in favour of alternative P(S|A)>p

Item.Name: Upper Critical Implication
Item.Description: The binomical test does not reject on the level alpha the null hypothesis P(S|A)<=p in favour of alternative P(S|A)>p

Item.Name: Double p-Implication
Item.Description: a/(a+b+c) >= p ... at least 100*p [%] of objects satisfying A or S satisfy both A and S

Item.Name: Double Lower Critical Implication
Item.Description: The binomical test rejects on the level alpha the null hypothesis P(AandS|AorS)<=p in favour of alternative P(AandS|AorS)>p

Item.Name: Double Upper Critical Implication
Item.Description: The binomical test does not reject on the level alpha the null hypothesis P(AandS|AorS)<=p in favour of alternative P(AandS|AorS)>p

Item.Name: p-Equivalence
Item.Description: (a+d)/n >= p ... at least 100*p [%] objects have the same truth value for A and S

Item.Name: Lower Critical Equivalence
Item.Description: The binomical test rejects on the level alpha the null hypothesis P(A and S have the same truth value)<=p in favour of alternative P(A and S have the same truth value)>p

Item.Name: Upper Critical Equivalence
Item.Description: The binomical test does not reject on the level alpha the null hypothesis P(A and S have the same truth value)<=p in favour of alternative P(A and S have the same truth value)>p

Item.Name: Simple Deviation
Item.Description: a*d > exp(delta)*b*c

Item.Name: Fisher quantifier
Item.Description: The one-sided Fisher test rejects on the level alpha the null hypothesis of independence of A and S in favour of the alternative of their positive logarithmic interaction

Item.Name: Chi-Square quantifier
Item.Description: The Chi-Square test asymptotically rejects on the level alpha the null hypothesis of independence of A and S in favour of the alternative of their positive logarithmic interaction

Item.Name: Paraconsistent separation
Item.Description: Paraconsistent separation quantifier looking for (almost) separate A and S with truth-criterion of (1+p)*a<=b+c. It is recommend also to set-up a simple-frequency quantifier for (b+c) to assure some minimal sample size.

Item.Name: BASE
Item.Description: a >= BASE ... at least BASE-number of objects for dependency to be statistically relevant

Item.Name: Ceiling
Item.Description: a <= CEIL ... not more than CEIL-number of objects (i.e. not too 'obvious' dependency)

Item.Name: a-frequency
Item.Description: a-frequency from contingency table

Item.Name: b-frequency
Item.Description: b-frequency from contingency table

Item.Name: c-frequency
Item.Description: c-frequency from contingency table

Item.Name: d-frequency
Item.Description: d-frequency from contingency table

Item.Name: r-frequency
Item.Description: r-frequency (a+b) from contingency table

Item.Name: s-frequency
Item.Description: s-frequency (c+d) from contingency table

Item.Name: k-frequency
Item.Description: k-frequency (a+c) from contingency table

Item.Name: l-frequency
Item.Description: l-frequency (b+d) from contingency table

Item.Name: ad-frequency
Item.Description: ad-frequency (a+d) from contingency table

Item.Name: bc-frequency
Item.Description: bc-frequency (b+c) from contingency table

Item.Name: Sum of values
Item.Description: Sum of frequencies (n) from contingency table

Item.Name: Min value
Item.Description: Minimal frequency from contingency table

Item.Name: Max value
Item.Description: Maximal frequency from contingency table

Item.Name: Frequency difference
Item.Description: Frequency of corresponding category in histogram minus number of rows matching both antecedent and succedent

Item.Name: Relative frequencies difference
Item.Description: Difference of relative frequency of a corresponding category in histogram and confidence

Item.Name: Absolute value of relative frequencies difference
Item.Description: Absolute value of difference of relative frequency of a corresponding category in histogram and confidence

Item.Name: Ratio of relative frequencies
Item.Description: Ratio of relative frequency in histogram to relative frequency of succedent in rows matching antecedent (i.e. "inverse Lift")

Item.Name: Relative frequencies of category difference
Item.Description: Difference of relative frequency of category in histogram to the frequency of this category in the whole data and relative frequency of rows matching both antecedent and succedent to frequency of category in the whole data

Item.Name: Absolute value of relative frequencies of category difference
Item.Description: Absolute value of difference of relative frequency of category in histogram to the frequency of this category in the whole data and relative frequency of rows matching both antecedent and succedent to frequency of category in the whole data

Item.Name: Ratio of relative frequencies of category
Item.Description: Ratio of relative frequency of category in histogram to the frequency of this category in the whole data and relative frequency of rows matching both antecedent and succedent to frequency of category in the whole data

Item.Name: Absolute number
Item.Description: Absolute number. Threshold value is left as given.

Item.Name: Relative [%] to act condition
Item.Description: Relative to number of rows matching condition. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows matching condition)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to all objects
Item.Description: Relative to number of all rows in the data matrix. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows in the whole matrix)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to max frequency
Item.Description: Relative to maximal frequency in the current contingency table. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (the highest frequency)/100

Item.Name: Positive
Item.Description: Positive gace

Item.Name: Negative
Item.Description: Negative gace (negation)

Item.Name: Both
Item.Description: Both (positive and negative)

Item.Name: In-Polygon name
Item.Description: Name of the polygon the coordinates are within

Item.Name: Closest-Point name
Item.Description: Name of the closest point to the coordinates

Item.Name: Closest-Point distance
Item.Description: Distance [km] from the coordinates to the the closest point

Item.Name: Point-number
Item.Description: Number of points within a distance [km] from the coordinates (distance given by a threshold value)

Item.Name: Not set
Item.Description: Not applicable to this attribute

Item.Name: Euclidean
Item.Description: Euclidean distance of cartesian planar coordinates.

Item.Name: Cylindrical
Item.Description: Euclidean distance on cylindrical projection of geographical coordinates (WGS84) and transformed into kilometers. Applicable for points up to 500 km apart and within latitudes of 70N and 70S.

Item.Name: Haversine
Item.Description: Haversine formula for computing distances on the sphere for geographical coordinates (WGS84) and transformed into kilometers. The better precison for large distances on the Earth, but slowest.

Item.Name: Not set
Item.Description: Not applicable to this attribute

Item.Name: Finite value
Item.Description: Finite value (not infinity)

Item.Name: Plus infinity
Item.Description: Plus infinity value

Item.Name: Minus infinity
Item.Description: Minus infinity value

Item.Name: From
Item.Description: Left border value

Item.Name: To
Item.Description: Right border value

Item.Name: Fuzzy from (min)
Item.Description: First left fuzzy border value

Item.Name: Fuzzy from (max)
Item.Description: Second left fuzzy border value

Item.Name: Fuzzy to (min)
Item.Description: First right fuzzy border value

Item.Name: Fuzzy to (max)
Item.Description: Second right fuzzy border value

Item.Name: Absolute number
Item.Description: Absolute frequencies. Frequencies in histogram are left as given.

Item.Name: Relative [%] to act condition
Item.Description: Relative frequencies to number of rows matching condition. Frequencies are divided by number of rows matching condition and multiplied by 100.

Item.Name: Relative [%] for each row
Item.Description: Relative frequencies for each row. Each frequency is divided by the sum of frequencies in its row and multiplied by 100.

Item.Name: Relative [%] for each column
Item.Description: Relative frequencies for each column. Each frequency is divided by the sum of frequencies in its column and multiplied by 100.

Item.Name: Sum of frequencies
Item.Description: Sum of frequencies from given part of contingency table

Item.Name: Min frequency
Item.Description: Minimal frequency from given part of contingency table

Item.Name: Max frequency
Item.Description: Maximal frequency from given part of contingency table

Item.Name: Average frequency
Item.Description: Average frequency from given part of contingency table

Item.Name: Some frequency
Item.Description: At least one frequency from given part of contingency table

Item.Name: Cramer's V coefficient
Item.Description: Cramer's V (association of two nominal variables) in <0;1> (the farther is value from 0 the more dependant)

Item.Name: Kendall's TauB coefficient
Item.Description: Kendall's TauB (coefficient of ordinal correlation of two variables) in <-1;1> (the farther is value from 0 the more dependant)

Item.Name: Chi-square test
Item.Description: Chi-square test of similarity (the greater value the more dependant)

Item.Name: Variation from pattern
Item.Description: Total variation from pattern

Item.Name: Conditional entropy H(C|R)
Item.Description: Conditional entropy of columns given rows (the lower value the more dependant <0;log2(L)>)

Item.Name: Mutual information MI(R,C) normalized
Item.Description: Mutual information between rows and columns (the greater value the more dependant <0;1>)

Item.Name: Inf. dependence ID(R,C)
Item.Description: Information dependence between rows and columns (the greater value the more dependant <0;1>)

Item.Name: Asymetric information coefficient AIC(R,C)
Item.Description: Value of asymetric information coefficient Theta (the greater value the more dependant <0;1>)

Item.Name: PattDiffSum
Item.Description: Sum of absolute values of differences of frequencies in the contingency table and a given pattern

Item.Name: PattDiffMin
Item.Description: The minimal of absolute values of differences of frequencies in the contingency table and a given pattern

Item.Name: PattDiffMax
Item.Description: The maximal of absolute values of differences of frequencies in the contingency table and a given pattern

Item.Name: Absolute number
Item.Description: Absolute number. Threshold value is left as given.

Item.Name: Relative [%] to act condition
Item.Description: Relative to number of rows matching condition. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows matching condition)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to all objects
Item.Description: Relative to number of all rows in the data matrix. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (number of rows in the whole matrix)/100

Item.Name: Relative [%] to max frequency
Item.Description: Relative to maximal frequency in the whole contingency table. Threshold value [%] is multiplied by (the highest frequency in the whole KL-table)/100

Item.Name: Antecedent
Item.Description: Mapping attributes to antecedent

Item.Name: Succedent
Item.Description: Mapping attributes to succedent

Item.Name: Condition
Item.Description: Mapping attributes to condition

Item.Name: FirstSet
Item.Description: Mapping attributes to the firstset

Item.Name: SecondSet
Item.Description: Mapping attributes to the secondset

Item.Name: Quantifier
Item.Description: Mapping of quantifier

Item.Name: Filter
Item.Description: Mapping of filtering

Item.Name: Not set
Item.Description: Influence not set yet

Item.Name: Don't care
Item.Description: Not interested in this combination

Item.Name: To be mined
Item.Description: Waiting for to be mined

Item.Name: Being processed
Item.Description: Beeing processed

Item.Name: Solved
Item.Description: Results obtained

Item.Name: 4ftMiner
Item.Description: 4ftMiner Task

Item.Name: CF-Miner
Item.Description: CF-Miner Task

Item.Name: KL-Miner
Item.Description: KL-Miner Task

Item.Name: SD4ft-Miner
Item.Description: SD4ft-Miner Task

Item.Name: SDCF-Miner
Item.Description: SDCF-Miner Task

Item.Name: SDKL-Miner
Item.Description: SDKL-Miner Task

Item.Name: Basic
Item.Description: Literal must be included in every cedent

Item.Name: Remaining
Item.Description: Literal is obligatory in cedent

Item.Name: k-Means / k-Mode
Item.Description: Flat level k-Means or k-Mode clustering

Item.Name: Repeated bisection k-Means / k-Mode
Item.Description: Top-down recursive bi-section clustering producing a tree of clusters

Item.Name: Hierarchical Agglomerative Clustering
Item.Description: Bottom-up hierarchical agglomerative clustering using distance matrix

Item.Name: Mean
Item.Description: Mean of category-index values

Item.Name: Modus
Item.Description: The most frequent category

Item.Name: Euclidean distance
Item.Description: Euclidean measure of distance between two objects

Item.Name: Cosinus similarity
Item.Description: Cosinus measure of similarity between two objects

Item.Name: Simple match
Item.Description: Simple match of categories (Sokal and Michener)

Item.Name: Eskin measure
Item.Description: Esking similarity for nominal variables (Eskin et al.)

Item.Name: Variable Entropy
Item.Description: Variable Entropy similarity measure of nominal variables (Sulc)

Item.Name: Variable Mutability
Item.Description: Variable Mutability similarity measure of nominal variables (Sulc)

Item.Name: Simple
Item.Description: Simple linkage of clusters (the minimal distance)

Item.Name: Complete
Item.Description: Complete linkage of clusters (the maximal distance)

Item.Name: Average
Item.Description: Average linkage of clusters (the average distance)

Item.Name: Delete
Item.Description: Not including missing values

Item.Name: Pesimistic fill up
Item.Description: Pesimistic fill up of missing values

Item.Name: Optimistic fill up
Item.Description: Pesimistic fill up of missing values

Item.Name: Ignore X-categories
Item.Description: Ignoring X-categories

Item.Name: Not set
Item.Description: Scope not set yet

Item.Name: Background knowledge
Item.Description: Dependency follows from the domain background knowledge

Item.Name: Data specific
Item.Description: Dependency follows from data anomalies

Item.Name: Unknown
Item.Description: Scope is unknown

Item.Name: Not set
Item.Description: Influence not set yet

Item.Name: Some influence
Item.Description: There is some influence but not examined in detail

Item.Name: Positive influence
Item.Description: If the row attribute increases then the column attribute increases too

Item.Name: Negative influence
Item.Description: If the row attribute increases then the column attribute decreases

Item.Name: Positive frequency
Item.Description: If the row attribute increases then the relative frequency of objects satisfying column attribute increases

Item.Name: Negative frequency
Item.Description: If the row attribute increases then the relative frequency of objects satisfying column attribute decreases

Item.Name: Positive boolean
Item.Description: If truthfulness of the row attribute increases then relative frequency of true values of column attribute increases too

Item.Name: Negative boolean
Item.Description: If truthfulness of the row attribute increases then relative frequency of true values of column attribute decreases

Item.Name: Functional
Item.Description: There is a strong function-like dependency

Item.Name: None
Item.Description: No influence at all

Item.Name: Don't care about influence
Item.Description: There maybe some influence but we don't care

Item.Name: Unknown
Item.Description: There could be an influence, no details are known

Item.Name: Not set
Item.Description: Validity not set yet

Item.Name: Proven
Item.Description: Dependency proven

Item.Name: Rejected
Item.Description: Dependency was rejected

Item.Name: Unknown
Item.Description: Validity not know

Item.Name: None
Item.Description: Not set

Item.Name: Equal versus Not-equal
Item.Description: One category against all others. As many dichotimized attributes with categories '=' and '<>' as there is categories in the original attribute. Suitable for nominal attributes.

Item.Name: Up-to versus Above
Item.Description: Disjunction of all categories up to a certain category against all other categories. As many dichotomized attributes with categories '<=' and '>' as there is categories in the original attribute minus one. Suitable for ordinal and cardinal attributes.

Item.Name: Random
Item.Description: Column values generated randomly

Item.Name: Initialized by formula
Item.Description: Column values initially computed by a mathematical formula

Item.Name: Updated by formula
Item.Description: Column values continuously updated by a mathematical formula

Item.Name: Copied from the underlying data
Item.Description: Column values initialized by copying values from the underlying data

Item.Name: Evolution
Item.Description: Generating artificial data using evolutionary algorithm

Item.Name: Randomizer
Item.Description: Randomization of previously generated data using evolution algorithm

Item.Name: Uniform
Item.Description: Uniform distribution of values across possible range

Item.Name: Gaussian
Item.Description: A bell-shaped distribution with defined mean value and standard deviation

Item.Name: Manually user-specified
Item.Description: Manually specified frequencies (for enumerations only)

Item.Name: Random
Item.Description: Randomly generated values for each individual

Item.Name: Permutation
Item.Description: Permutation of a one-time pregenerated random values

Item.Name: Enumeration
Item.Description: Column could contain values only from a pre-defined list

Item.Name: Range of values
Item.Description: Column with any value within a given range

Item.Name: Range with predefined values
Item.Description: Column with any value within a given range with some predefined values

Item.Name: FirstSet versus SecondSet
Item.Description: Comparison of the first set versus the second set

Item.Name: FirstSet versus FirstSet and SecondSet
Item.Description: The second set is treated as a subset specification to the first set

Item.Name: FirstSet versus not FirstSet
Item.Description: The second set is inverse of the first set

Item.Name: First set frequencies
Item.Description: Quantifier test applied to the first set data only

Item.Name: Second set frequencies
Item.Description: Quantifier test applied to the second set data only

Item.Name: Delta of absolute frequencies values
Item.Description: Quantifier test applied to the frequency table computed by substracting of corresponding frequencies

Item.Name: Delta of relative frequencies values
Item.Description: Quantifier test applied to the frequency table computed by substracting of corresponding relative frequencies

Item.Name: Difference of interest-measures
Item.Description: Test applied to the difference of quantifier values computed separately from each frequency table

Item.Name: Absolute difference of interest-measures
Item.Description: Test applied to the absolute difference of interest-measures computed separately from each frequency table

Item.Name: Ratio of interest-measures
Item.Description: Test applied to the ratio of interest-measures computed separately from each frequency table

Item.Name: Higher of ratios of interest-measures
Item.Description: Test applied to the higher of two ratios of interest-measures (im1/im2 or im2/im1)

Item.Name: 4ft-Miner
Item.Description: 4ft-Miner task for 4ft-association rules with rich syntax

Item.Name: CF-Miner
Item.Description: CF-Miner task for conditonal frequencies of a single multi-categorical attribute

Item.Name: KL-Miner
Item.Description: KL-Miner task for conditional frequencies of two multi-categorical attributes

Item.Name: SD4ft-Miner
Item.Description: SD4ft-Miner task for set difference in terms of two 4ft-association rules

Item.Name: SDCF-Miner
Item.Description: SDCF-Miner task for set difference in terms of two frequencies of a single attribute

Item.Name: SDKL-Miner
Item.Description: SDKL-Miner task for set difference in terms of two frequencies of two multi-categorical attributes

Item.Name: Ac4ft-Miner
Item.Description: Ac4ft-Miner task for 4ft-action rules

Item.Name: ETree-Miner
Item.Description: ETree-Miner task for decision and exploration trees

Item.Name: MCluster-Miner
Item.Description: MCluster-Miner task for clustering analysis

Item.Name: Knowledge Explorer
Item.Description: Knowledge Explorer (KEx) task for classifications using machine learning

Item.Name: Use training set
Item.Description: Use same records as for training

Item.Name: Cross-validation
Item.Description: Cross-validating each of n-folds

Item.Name: Random split
Item.Description: Random split of available data in given ration

Item.Name: Integer number
Item.Description: Integer number between -2E09 and 2E09

Item.Name: Decimal number
Item.Description: Floating-point number with double precision

Item.Name: Text
Item.Description: String of characters

Item.Name: Boolean
Item.Description: Boolean value of TRUE/FALSE

Item.Name: Date/Time
Item.Description: Value with date, time or both
